title: GitRepo.update_submodule() cannot handle non-master branch in submodule

labels.name: severity-minor
labels.description: a problem which doesn't affect the package's usefulness, and is presumably trivial to fix

body:
Originally discovered by @adswa and reproducible with this:

```
% datalad clone https://gin.g-node.org/adswa/OSRdemo
% cd OSRdemo
% datalad get -n .source
[INFO   ] Scanning for unlocked files (this may take some time)                              
[INFO   ] Configured RIA store not found at ria+file:///ds/hcp/srv 
[WARNING] /tmp/OSRdemo/.source has a detached HEAD since cloned branch master has another common ancestor with 957c6a58 
install(ok): /tmp/OSRdemo/.source (dataset) [Installed subdataset in order to get /tmp/OSRdemo/.source]
```

`.source` stays with a detached head.

For good reasons, the superdataset is on the `master` branch, while the submodule references a dataset state in a `bids` branch. The logic inside is therefore broken https://github.com/datalad/datalad/blob/master/datalad/support/gitrepo.py#L2941

We would need to record the target branch of a submodule in a parent to fix this issue. This is a long identified need #1424, an implementation was attempted #3817, and removed again #4375 due to problems with the approach #4373 

Severity minor, because the warning is annoying, but there is no real issue in the context of the use case above.
